data.title: Stark County roundup: News from around the Canton region
data.meta_description: The Canton Repository has compiled a roundup of community news.
data.text:
The Malyuk Sisters at Haven of Rest

AKRON – The Haven of Rest Women’s Auxiliary presents The Malyuk Sisters on Tuesday. Lisa and Heather Malyuk are celebrated performing artists in the U.S. and abroad. They play interpretations of old-time Appalachian, Celtic, World, and original Folk music on hammered dulcimer, coupled with inventive guitar, fiddle, and banjo. Their repertoire includes reels and jigs, bittersweet waltzes, international rhythms and old-fashioned sacred music.

Bargain shopping that supports the Mission starts at 10 a.m., the light luncheon is at noon, and the free program is at 1 p.m. No membership is required. There will also be a door prize.

Auxiliary is held the first Tuesday of each month in the main dining room of Haven of Rest, 175 E. Market St. Call or email Rose at 330-535-1563, rrose@havenofrest.org for more information. Free parking is available.

Volunteers needed

AKRON – Crossroads Hospice & Palliative Care in Northeast Ohio is seeking positive, energetic and compassionate volunteers. Volunteers are needed throughout the Akron and Northeast region including Stark, Summit, Portage, Medina, Wayne, Tuscarawas, Carroll, Columbiana and Mahoning counties, according to a news release.

Volunteers provide direct comfort, companionship and a helping hand to terminally ill patients and their families in their homes, assisted-living facilities and nursing facilities. All first-time volunteers are provided with ample support, including a training program and regular feedback. A Crossroads Volunteer Manager always accompanies a volunteer on every first patient visit. Not all volunteer positions at Crossroads require interaction with patients and their families. Administrative volunteer assignments in the office also are available.

Volunteers can be as young as 16. For more information about volunteering at Crossroads, contact Robin Brown at 330-776-3271 or visit crossroadshospice.com/volunteering.

Kids craft program at library

ALLIANCE – Children ages 7-12, are invited to the Rodman Public Library at 4 p.m. Thursday, Nov. 4, to make a Fall Luminary Jar. Space is limited to 20 participants and registration is required by visiting rodmanlibrary.evanced.info/signup or by calling the Children’s Department at 330-821-2665, ext. 223. The monthly craft event is supported by the Friends of Rodman Library.

Sarah Kay at Malone University

CANTON – Celebrated performer Sarah Kay will speak at 7:30 p.m. Wednesday in the Johnson Center as part of the Malone University Writers Series. Kay is a New Yorker, a poetry writer and reader, an educator, and the founder and co-director of Project VOICE. She wrote four best-selling books of poetry including B, No Matter the Wreckage, The Type, and All Our Wild Wonder. She is an editor for Write Bloody Publishing. Kay has been featured as a speaker at the TED conference. She was the youngest competitor at the National Poetry Slam in 2006. She is a featured performer at events and venues like Carnegie Hall, the United Nations, the Tribeca Film Festival, Lincoln Center Out of Doors, the Nantucket Project, the Apollo Theater and the Royal Danish Theatre, among hundreds more.

For more information call 330-471-8521

CommQuest elects two new board members

CANTON – CommQuest Services has two new board members: Greg Boudreaux, chief of campus security at Stark State College, and John Spieler, chief executive officer of St. Luke Lutheran Community.

Boudreaux has led campus security at Stark State since 2018, and served part-time with Walsh University for 23 years prior to that, helping to form the university’s police department. Before assuming his role at Stark State, he retired as a lieutenant with the Canton Police Department after a 32-year career, during which he served as one of Stark County’s first DARE (Drug Abuse Resistance Education) officers and was honored as police officer of the year in 1992. He was recognized with the Coming Together Stark County Diversity Initiative Award in 2016.

Spieler has been president and CEO of St. Luke Lutheran Community since 2007. St. Luke, a multi-site senior-living organization has locations in North Canton, Portage Lakes and Minerva. He is an adjunct professor for the College of Public Health, Kent State University. He earned a Doctor of Public Health degree from the University of Pittsburgh’s Graduate School of Public Health and an MBA in health services administration from Temple University. During his career, he has served as a CEO/senior executive of hospitals, healthcare systems, and long-term care organizations. Spieler’s first job in healthcare was as one of the first Paramedics for the City of Pittsburgh.

To learn more about CommQuest Services, visit CommQuest.org or call 330-455-0374.

‘Honoring our Nation's Heroes' event Saturday

CANTON – The Pro Football Hall of Fame will salute with its "Honoring our Nation's Heroes" event at 11 a.m. Saturday. This year’s program will feature special guest of honor Lt. Gen. Robert L. Van Antwerp Jr., who will speak about lessons in leadership, integrity and teamwork. In addition, several Medal of Honor recipients will be on hand for the program. Visitors also will enjoy a display of military related artifacts in a special exhibit. The first 250 guests will receive a “Veterans Day 2021 Challenge Coin.” For more information, visit www.profootballhof.com/events/2021-honoring-our-nationsheroes/.

The Pro Football Hall of Fame will provide free Museum admission and parking to all U.S. service members, National Guard and veterans, plus a guest, on Saturday and Nov. 11. Blue Star and Gold Star families also will receive complimentary admission and parking on those dates. Valid proof of military service must be shown at the Hall’s Box Office. Additionally, each of these parties will receive a 20% discount in the Hall of Fame Store on those two days.

Dances Nov. 7, 10

CANTON – Canton Country Music will hold the following dances open to the public at Nazir Grotto, 1717 Sixth St. SW: Nov. 7, with music by Hot Cargo Band, and Nov. 14, with music by Pat Massie & PM Band. Doors open at 1 p.m., and music is from 2-5 p.m. Food and 50-50 drawing available. Admission is $3 at the door.

Farmers’ Breakfast will be Thursday

CANTON TWP. – The Stark Soil and Water Conservation District’s monthly Stark Farmers’ Breakfast will be Thursday at Ferraro’s Family Restaurant, 3822 Navarre Rd SW. A general roundtable discussion covering Precision Ag Technology will start at 8 a.m. Meals are optional and at your own expense. Contact Stark Soil and Water at 330-451-SOIL (7645) for more information.

VeteRun at Quail Hollow Park

LAKE TWP. – Stark Parks’ 2021 VeteRun, an untimed 5K fun run and 1-mile family fun run/walk will take place Saturday. The run will be at Quail Hollow Park along a flag-lined trail honoring Stark Parks veteran staff and volunteers.

Registration begins at 8 a.m., Honor Guard and flag raising will be at 9 a.m., and the untimed 5K and 1-mile run/walk will follow. The first 250 race finishers will receive a commemorative medal. There will be activities after the run, including a card-making station, where you can create a card for a veteran, and you’ll have the chance to try out the obstacle course. All activities, including the run, are free and go until 11 a.m. Registration is available at starkparks.com/veterun/ or register the day of the event, beginning at 8 a.m. Quail Hollow Park is at 13480 Congress Lake Ave.

Hydrant flushing this week

MAGNOLIA – The Water Department will be flushing fire hydrants this week between 9 a.m. and 3 p.m., according to the village Board of Public Affairs. The water may be discolored after the hydrants have been flushed.

Job fair Thursday

MASSILLON – The City of Massillon is hosting a job fair Thursday. Job seekers can attend in person or virtually. The job fair will be from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the Massillon Rec Center, 505 Erie St. N. Those unable to attend in person are urged to attend virtually.

The event will feature 20 local employers representing a variety of industries. Each employer will have both an in person and virtual booth featuring current job openings at varying levels of experience. The following employers will be participating in this event: Danbury Senior Living, Ball Metalpack, Fresh Mark, Clearpath Home Health, Aultman Health, C&K Industrial Services, Midwestern Industries, Shearer’s Foods, Hendrickson, Superior Dairy, Vitreo-Retinal Consultants, Todd’s Enviroscapes, Lane Logix Traffic Control, Kenan Advantage Group, Cortech, Allied Universal Security Services, YMCA of Central Stark County, PSI Industrial Solutions, Kimble Recycling and Disposal, Tower Industries.

Attendees can register for the virtual job fair at https://pvapi.premiervirtual.com/s/0W9Ljx. Job seekers are encouraged to register early to upload their résumés and qualifications, explore companies and open positions, and sign up to receive alerts and reminders leading up to and throughout the event.

For support in preparing for the job fair, contact OhioMeansJobs Stark County, Goodwill Industries of Greater Cleveland and East Central Ohio, Greater Stark County Urban League, or Stark County Community Action Agency. Job seekers are also urged to follow OhioMeansJobs Stark and Tuscarawas Counties on social media to receive job fair updates and tips. For further information, contact OhioMeansJobs Stark County at 330-433-9675 or info@omjwork.com.

'Do the Mu' painting workshop Saturday

MASSILLON – Erika Reynolds will teach “Fall Inspiration: Painting with Fruits and Vegetables” at the Massillon Museum’s “Do the Mu!” workshop between noon and 2 p.m. Saturday. The in-person, hands-on workshop is for all ages. Attendees will create a fall inspiration scene – like an owl in an apple tree – with fruits and veggies.

Do the Mu is free and open to everyone. Participants may drop in any time during the workshop. All materials and tools are provided. No registration is required.

Eagles tribute at Lions Lincoln Theatre

MASSILLON – The band Hotel California will perform the music of The Eagles at 7:30 p.m. Saturday at the Lions Lincoln Theatre. Tickets are $20, $25 and $30. All seats are reserved and can be purchased at www.lionslincolntheatre.org or by calling 330-481-9105. The remaining tickets may be purchased at the box office one hour before showtime.
